text: The average age of people living in England's big cities rose by 6 months between 2002 & 2017 (37 to 37.5).  The average age in isolated English villages rose more than 4 years (43.9 to 48) over the same period. @DefraStats
author: BBCMarkEaston

text: Saw this in Northampton yesterday - but didn’t spot the lion.
author: BBCMarkEaston

text: Bad news or good news?  The price of the average house In England is now FALLING, down 1% in January compared to the previous month, according to @landregistry figures today.
author: BBCMarkEaston

text: Half full? Or half empty? Happy International Happiness Day. It’s good to take a moment to count your blessings. #HappinessDay
author: BBCMarkEaston
